c74object.name: ta.crossover
c74object.digest: Generate lists by mixing two parent lists
c74object.description: Implementation of a genetic algorithm (GA) to create new offspring lists from two parent lists. This algorithm features: mutation ratio, mix ratio from each parent, different list sizes, floats, ints and symbols, as well as the number of crossover points, allowing lists to be crossed over in chunks of list elements within a certain length.

outlet.description: Generates a new list by mixing items from two input parent lists ("A" and "B").

method.name: bang
method.description: Generates a new list by mixing items from two input parent lists ("A" and "B").

attribute.name: points
attribute.description: Setting the number of crossover points allows you to process lists in chunks, this can be useful if you want to process lists that contain smaller groups of elements like, for example, note lists containing pitch-velocity pairs. So, if the points attribute is set to 2, generated lists will contain pairs of numbers from its parents lists. (default = 1, which mixes lists item by item)

attribute.name: mutation
attribute.description: Introduce random items in the offspring list. 0 means no mutation and 1 means all list elements will be mutated. While a mutation value of 0.5 would generate a list of half of its elements mutated. (default = 0.)

attribute.name: mix
attribute.description: This allows you to set the weight of each parent list when generating the new offspring. A mix ratio of 0.5 will give an equal weighted offspring, while a mix ratio towards 0 or 1 will tend to have more list elements elements belonging to parent "A" or parent "B", respectively.

example.caption: Generating musical scales through genetic algorithms.

entry.name: int/float/symbol/list
entry.description: Generated offspring list, containing elements from both parent lists ("A" and "B"), having either int, float or symbol elements.
